intro: Canthium acarophytum, commonly known as the spiny sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its spiny calyces and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Canthium acarophytum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
